title: The NBA's 'regret' shows how Chinese censorship really works
text:
I’m no basketball fan, but this week I found myself watching a statement made by the LA Lakers player LeBron James. Mr James has spoken out on public issues a fair amount over the years – Darfur, US police shootings and presidential politics. But this time he was making a rather different point: “Yes we do have freedom of speech,” he said, looking down at his shoes, “but there are ramifications for the negative that can happen when you are not thinking about others.”

“Ramifications for the negative” is a way of saying “it costs megabucks”. Last week, a man called Daryl Morey, general manager of Florida team the Rockets, posted an image on Twitter expressing support for pro-democracy protesters...
